verses.text: 蛙災耶和華對摩西說：「你到法老那裡去，對他說：『耶和華這樣說：「讓我的人民離開這裡，使他們可以事奉我。

words.note: A plague of frogs
Title of ancient Egyptian rulers
A verb-object compound implying service or worship.

verses.text: 如果你拒絕讓他們離開這裡，看哪，我必用青蛙擊打你的全境。

words.note: Used to draw attention, similar to 'behold' in English Bibles.

verses.text: 河裡必滋生青蛙；青蛙必上來，進到你的宮殿和臥房裡去，跳上你的床，進你臣僕的房屋，跳上你人民的身上，進你的爐子和摶麵盆。

words.note: Functions as a directional complement, indicating movement away.
Refers to a basin for kneading dough.

verses.text: 青蛙也必跳上你、你的人民和臣僕的身上。」』」
耶和華對摩西說：「你要對亞倫說把手中的杖伸在江、河、池之上，使青蛙上到埃及地來。」

words.note: Introduces direct object before verb.
Literary way to express 'above'.
Combines 'Egypt' and 'land'.

verses.text: 亞倫把手一伸在埃及的眾水之上，青蛙就上來了，並且遮蓋了埃及地。

words.note: Lit. 'one stretch'

verses.text: 眾術士也用他們的巫術照樣行了，使青蛙上了埃及地來。
法老把摩西和亞倫召了來，說：「請你們懇求耶和華，好叫他使青蛙離開我和我的人民，我就必讓這人民離開這裡，使他們可以向耶和華獻祭。」
摩西回答法老：「請指示，我要在甚麼時候為你和你的臣僕，以及你的人民，懇求耶和華除滅青蛙，使青蛙離開你和你的宮殿，只留在河裡呢？」
法老說：「明天。」摩西回答：「就照著你的話行吧，好叫你知道沒有神像耶和華我們的 神。

words.definition: there is no, does not have

words.note: Here referring to a generic god, distinguished from the true God.
With the preceding space, it refers to the singular true God.

verses.text: 青蛙必離開你和你的宮殿、你的臣僕和你的人民，只留在河裡。」

words.note: Commonly used in ancient and biblical contexts.

verses.text: 於是，摩西和亞倫離開法老走了出來；摩西為了耶和華加在法老身上青蛙的災害向耶和華呼求。

words.note: Title for the ancient Egyptian king.
Transliteration of 'Yahweh', the personal name of God.
Often used in biblical context for plagues or calamities.
Often means to 'call upon' God in prayer.

verses.text: 耶和華就照著摩西的話行了；在房屋裡、院子裡和田野中的青蛙都死了。
有人把青蛙一堆一堆積聚起來，那地就發臭了。

words.note: Repetition of 一堆 for emphasis: 'in piles and piles'.
Used as a verb complement to indicate rising or gathering.

verses.text: 法老一見災禍平息了，就心裡剛硬，不肯聽他們的話，就像耶和華所說的。

words.note: Used with another verb (一見) to mean 'as soon as (one) sees'.
Biblical usage often refers to a hardened heart against God.
Indicates the object or result of the following verb.
Together with 所, forms a nominalized phrase 'that which was said'.

verses.text: 虱災耶和華對摩西說：「你要對亞倫說：『伸出你的手杖，擊打地上的塵土，使塵土在埃及全地都變成虱子。』」

words.note: Specifically refers to a plague of lice.

words.definition: entire land, all over the land

verses.text: 他們就這樣行了；亞倫伸出手中的杖，擊打地上的塵土，就在人身上和牲畜身上有了虱子；埃及全地所有地上的塵土都變成了虱子。

words.definition: entire land, all over the land

verses.text: 眾術士也用他們的巫術照樣行，要生出虱子來，卻不能辦到；所以在人身上和牲畜身上都有虱子。

words.note: Often used to pluralize or emphasize multitude.
Refers to practitioners of magic, often in ancient contexts.
Functions as a directional complement here.

verses.text: 眾術士就對法老說：「這是 神的手指頭。」法老卻心裡剛硬，不肯聽摩西和亞倫，就像耶和華所說的。

words.note: Often used to pluralize or emphasize multitude.
Refers to practitioners of magic, often in ancient contexts.
Often capitalized or offset in Chinese Bibles.
Often used metaphorically for a stubborn heart in religious texts.

verses.text: 蠅災耶和華對摩西說：「你要清早起來，站在法老面前；看哪，法老到水邊來的時候，你要對他說：『耶和華這樣說：你要讓我的人民離開這裡，使他們可以事奉我。

words.note: Specifically refers to a plague of flies.
Commonly used in Christian contexts for serving or worshipping God.

verses.text: 如果你不讓我的人民離開這裡，看哪，我必叫蒼蠅落在你和你臣僕，以及人民的身上，進到你的宮殿；埃及人的房屋都必充滿蒼蠅，他們所在的地方也是這樣。

words.note: Common in biblical text to draw attention.
Indicates strong certainty or necessity.
Used here in the context of the plague of flies.
Refers to royal or governmental servants.

words.definition: on the body, on one's person

words.note: Refers to the people of Egypt.
Indicates strong certainty or necessity.
Used here in the context of the plague of flies.

verses.text: 那日，我必把我人民居住的地方歌珊分別出來，使那裡沒有蒼蠅，為要使你知道在全地上只有我是耶和華。

words.note: Indicates strong certainty or necessity.
Introduces the direct object before the verb.
An ancient region of Egypt, mentioned in the Bible.
Indicates separation for a specific purpose.
Used here in the context of the plague of flies.

words.definition: in order to, for the purpose of

words.note: The personal name of God in the Old Testament.

verses.text: 我必把我的人民和你的人民分別出來（按照《馬索拉文本》，「分別出來」作「設定救贖」﹔兩者在原文非常相似，現參照《七十士譯本》等古譯本翻譯），明天必有這神蹟。』」

words.note: Indicates strong certainty or necessity.
Introduces the direct object before the verb.
Indicates separation for a specific purpose.
Indicates strong certainty or necessity.

verses.text: 耶和華就這樣行了；無數的蒼蠅進了法老的宮殿和他臣僕的房屋，並且遍布埃及全地；那地就因為蒼蠅的緣故毀壞了。

words.note: The personal name of God in the Old Testament.
Indicates consequence or immediate action.
Used here in the context of the plague of flies.
Title for the ancient Egyptian monarchs.
Refers to royal or governmental servants.
Indicates consequence or immediate action.
Used here in the context of the plague of flies.

verses.text: 法老把摩西和亞倫召了來，對他們說：「你們去，在這地獻祭給你們的 神吧。」

words.note: Title for the ancient Egyptian monarchs.
Introduces the direct object before the verb.
The prophet who led the Israelites out of Egypt.
Moses' brother, the first high priest of Israel.
Indicates movement towards the speaker/subject.
The leading space indicates reverence for God.

verses.text: 摩西回答：「決不可以這樣行，因為我們要把埃及人看為可憎的祭物獻給耶和華我們的 神；如果我們把埃及人看為可憎的祭物在他們眼前獻上，難道他們不拿石頭打死我們嗎？

words.note: Emphatic negation.
Introduces the object of a verb when it is to be acted upon.
埃及 (Egypt) + 人 (people).
Ideographic space, often used in Chinese Bibles to show reverence for God's name.

words.definition: could it be that?, don't tell me that...
words.note: Used to pose a rhetorical question.

words.definition: beat to death, kill by striking

verses.text: 我們要走三天的路程進到曠野，好照著耶和華吩咐我們的，向耶和華我們的 神獻祭。」

words.note: Here '好' acts as a conjunction introducing a purpose.
Here, nominalizes 'what Jehovah commanded us'.
Ideographic space, often used in Chinese Bibles to show reverence for God's name.

verses.text: 法老回答：「我必讓你們離開這裡，你們可以在曠野獻祭給耶和華你們的 神，只是你們不可走得太遠；請你們為我祈禱。」

words.note: Ideographic space, often used in Chinese Bibles to show reverence for God's name.
Connects a verb or adjective to a complement describing the manner or degree.

verses.text: 摩西說：「看哪，我要離開你出去，祈求耶和華，使蒼蠅明天可以離開法老和法老的臣僕，以及法老的人民，只是不可再行欺騙，不讓以色列人離開這裡去獻祭給耶和華。」

words.note: Common in biblical text for drawing attention.
以色列 (Israel) + 人 (people).

verses.text: 於是，摩西從法老那裡出來，去祈求耶和華。
耶和華就照著摩西的話行了，使蒼蠅離開了法老和他的臣僕，以及他的人民，連一隻也沒有留下。

words.note: Refers to the Pharaoh's court and staff.

words.definition: did not have, there was not

verses.text: 可是，這一次法老還是心裡剛硬，不肯讓以色列人離開。

words.note: Often used in scripture for a stubborn or unrepentant heart.
